document.title: 2021 Minnesota K12 Academic Standards in Social Studies Final

035A302014614883B4C206BEC2C7782B.description:
Explain how the demand and supply (foreign exchange) of
currencies determines exchange rates and, in turn, affects
trade.

CB9493CE90EF4849A45F51944F36C027.description:
Global and International:
Explain why people trade and
why nations encourage or limit
trade. Analyze the costs and
benefits of international trade
and globalization on communities
and the environment.

FCC7D03FFB714C5CBBD42BB287835B04.description:
Apply the principles of absolute and comparative advantage to
explain the increase in world production. Identify the situations
in which groups could benefit or lose with free-trade treaties,
trading blocs and trade barriers.

C5FA9B63968D498E9C1B32AF70B9DC0C.description:
Global and International:
Explain why people trade and
why nations encourage or limit
trade. Analyze the costs and
benefits of international trade
and globalization on communities
and the environment.

7A07FDE320D3480DBA0AF3544AE21062.description:
Explain interest rates and how interest rates are determined.
Explain how financial institutions (banks and credit unions)
make it possible for businesses to borrow and spend on new
capital investment (machinery, tools, equipment) and for
households to borrow and spend on purchases.

5D541212518F41619663099AC1C61AF2.description:
Global and International:
Explain why people trade and
why nations encourage or limit
trade. Analyze the costs and
benefits of international trade
and globalization on communities
and the environment.

D8596098BC98408181812A76D6D5DAB1.description:
Compare and contrast how various monetary policies of the
Federal Reserve are implemented. Predict how these policies
are likely to impact overall output, employment and the price
level.

673F6D743CA747C8BFFB9793129ECCE3.description:
Global and International:
Explain why people trade and
why nations encourage or limit
trade. Analyze the costs and
benefits of international trade
and globalization on communities
and the environment.

8C47B59AAC18488EB624B687787F3EEA.description:
Analyze and evaluate how various government fiscal policies
are likely to impact overall output, employment, the price level
and the national deficit/debt.

745728AA28DE4727AF807FA881DE46A4.description:
Global and International:
Explain why people trade and
why nations encourage or limit
trade. Analyze the costs and
benefits of international trade
and globalization on communities
and the environment.

214BF2F0F7E14112A94DA6C6DBC83008.description:
Graph short-run aggregate demand and aggregate supply to
describe change in output, employment and the price level.

DD497525B54C4B1D83DA43C0E970FA01.description:
Global and International:
Explain why people trade and
why nations encourage or limit
trade. Analyze the costs and
benefits of international trade
and globalization on communities
and the environment.

0E9A5F7CB7974181ACF3FD95306724B7.description:
Evaluate economic growth using a variety of indicators. Analyze
past and recent data to identify factors that promote or hinder
long-run economic growth and its sustainability.

2A14DC4DC83242D2B2CF93A3375C2A81.description:
Global and International:
Explain why people trade and
why nations encourage or limit
trade. Analyze the costs and
benefits of international trade
and globalization on communities
and the environment.

BDAB2D271FFB4FB983828A21CA3E6B45.description:
Measure inflation in terms of a percentage change in a price
index. Analyze past and recent data to explain how the money
supply is related to long-run inflation and how inflation affects
buyers, sellers, borrowers and lenders.

D0EFB998C1DE407AB2997946C58E120F.description:
Global and International:
Explain why people trade and
why nations encourage or limit
trade. Analyze the costs and
benefits of international trade
and globalization on communities
and the environment.

C647E8956C0149A0BA356E5C10CB1C6D.description:
Measure full employment in terms of the unemployment rate
and various types of unemployment. Analyze past and recent
data to describe factors that impact the long-run growth of jobs
in an economy.

69905C9F24154526A59E979551B5893E.description:
Global and International:
Explain why people trade and
why nations encourage or limit
trade. Analyze the costs and
benefits of international trade
and globalization on communities
and the environment.

60C9ED4B5FE643B8ABA1942E14242F54.description:
Analyze the causes of market failures due to externalities and
public goods and common resources. Evaluate potential
remedies.

80196DD63F3E4CB6B934E1585CCF826F.description:
Microeconomics: Explain and
evaluate how resources are used
and how goods and services are
distributed within different
economic systems. Analyze how
incentives influence the decisions
of consumers, producers, and
governments. Evaluate the
intended and unintended
consequences of these decisions
from multiple perspectives.

BEDE5F1234514361B5355D2A6C92CD6B.description:
Analyze the causes of market failures due to lack of competition
and lack of perfect information and barriers to resource
mobility. Evaluate potential remedies.

02929799384F443ABBA78D9370CB2ED9.description:
Microeconomics: Explain and
evaluate how resources are used
and how goods and services are
distributed within different
economic systems. Analyze how
incentives influence the decisions
of consumers, producers, and
governments. Evaluate the
intended and unintended
consequences of these decisions
from multiple perspectives.

0EB90D3D4866492CB24E3CF7744D9166.description:
Analyze the impact of various market structures on long-run
profit, price, and production and efficiency in a market. Explain
how market power can affect consumers.

D9467B9B4AF942E9ACD095DCA0BC9958.description:
Microeconomics: Explain and
evaluate how resources are used
and how goods and services are
distributed within different
economic systems. Analyze how
incentives influence the decisions
of consumers, producers, and
governments. Evaluate the
intended and unintended
consequences of these decisions
from multiple perspectives.

AFAC3C57ED9B495A8327126CD48C0A7F.description:
Compare and contrast characteristics of various market
structures.

2B1B991E473C47D9AF740A5874CA2911.description:
Microeconomics: Explain and
evaluate how resources are used
and how goods and services are
distributed within different
economic systems. Analyze how
incentives influence the decisions
of consumers, producers, and
governments. Evaluate the
intended and unintended
consequences of these decisions
from multiple perspectives.

FF00F3445DCE436E8B54D5B740BC5F33.description:
Explain how changes (shifts) in the demand and supply of an
item result in changes in its market price and quantity. Explain
how these shifts can lead to changes in prices and quantities in
other markets.

5FFA36A9B2B046E28C0249F1232DEE88.description:
Microeconomics: Explain and
evaluate how resources are used
and how goods and services are
distributed within different
economic systems. Analyze how
incentives influence the decisions
of consumers, producers, and
governments. Evaluate the
intended and unintended
consequences of these decisions
from multiple perspectives.

1E34C8C106B84180B08371FD7600A96C.description:
Use the market model (supply and demand) to analyze how the
interaction of individual buyers and sellers affects equilibrium
price and quantity and how shortages and surpluses affect
prices.

EA5C03DA529F4898A34114F2D1D4DB02.description:
Microeconomics: Explain and
evaluate how resources are used
and how goods and services are
distributed within different
economic systems. Analyze how
incentives influence the decisions
of consumers, producers, and
governments. Evaluate the
intended and unintended
consequences of these decisions
from multiple perspectives.

8C2130E2219A4547BE969CC8804F74AD.description:
Graph market supply and explain that market supply is based
on each sellerâ€™s cost and the number of sellers in the market.
Analyze the effect of factors that can change supply.

96AE4DA5DC354375BD136BB2D0292DE9.description:
Microeconomics: Explain and
evaluate how resources are used
and how goods and services are
distributed within different
economic systems. Analyze how
incentives influence the decisions
of consumers, producers, and
governments. Evaluate the
intended and unintended
consequences of these decisions
from multiple perspectives.

9FEE3578C86C416B97DC3415A881D8B7.description:
Graph market demand and explain that market demand is
based on each buyerâ€™s willingness and ability to pay and the
number of buyers in the market. Analyze the effect of factors
that can change demand.

48DFB107132E46A1A8D34A219EAAF0DE.description:
Microeconomics: Explain and
evaluate how resources are used
and how goods and services are
distributed within different
economic systems. Analyze how
incentives influence the decisions
of consumers, producers, and
governments. Evaluate the
intended and unintended
consequences of these decisions
from multiple perspectives.

71E26C24B8A34EB989413FDA142BF90E.description:
Use economic models to explain how resources, money, and
goods and services are exchanged in an economy.

1246B0FB4B6A44728ACC6A93365A3A14.description:
Microeconomics: Explain and
evaluate how resources are used
and how goods and services are
distributed within different
economic systems. Analyze how
incentives influence the decisions
of consumers, producers, and
governments. Evaluate the
intended and unintended
consequences of these decisions
from multiple perspectives.

D2C0CC8BEF264D6ABDE57FA64FB659C6.description:
Explain the pricing, sales, advertising and other marketing
strategies used to sell products from a consumer perspective.

699DCE20408940B0A5EC6C7339768FA1.description:
Personal Finance: Apply
economic concepts and models
to develop individual and
collective financial goals and
strategies for achieving these
goals, taking into consideration
historical and contemporary
conditions that either inhibit or
advance the creation of individual
and generational wealth.

241FDF1987C24CCBBEE6184F2CEFD6A1.description:
Evaluate the benefits and costs of credit. Explain how the
financial industry assesses oneâ€™s ability to manage credit and
how this affects oneâ€™s ability to borrow, rent, get a job and
achieve other financial goals.

F2D450887D584E2BA6D254D93D1E19F1.description:
Personal Finance: Apply
economic concepts and models
to develop individual and
collective financial goals and
strategies for achieving these
goals, taking into consideration
historical and contemporary
conditions that either inhibit or
advance the creation of individual
and generational wealth.

35EC55F4F77749109ED669CCA22D5F4A.description:
Evaluate how various household assets of property, housing,
stocks, bonds, savings accounts and monetizing creative
enterprises can generate income, considering risk, return and
time horizon.

E9C5FA59D025444F820678C87C9C3B75.description:
Personal Finance: Apply
economic concepts and models
to develop individual and
collective financial goals and
strategies for achieving these
goals, taking into consideration
historical and contemporary
conditions that either inhibit or
advance the creation of individual
and generational wealth.

C4DEF32E09B6420495B0BB1FF977BA61.description:
Establish personal financial goals. Create a financial plan,
considering budgeting and asset building, to meet those goals.
Determine the nature of the barriers the individual confronts.
Determine ways to track the success of the plan.

EF3B9B73693147208BDD34127966A701.description:
Personal Finance: Apply
economic concepts and models
to develop individual and
collective financial goals and
strategies for achieving these
goals, taking into consideration
historical and contemporary
conditions that either inhibit or
advance the creation of individual
and generational wealth.

F46E3AD80BAA4623A86CDA2C856F8D43.description:
Analyze how individual or household income is determined by a
variety of individual and social factors.

41D0AFA5287A4AFEBF0C1A7135FEEAC3.description:
Personal Finance: Apply
economic concepts and models
to develop individual and
collective financial goals and
strategies for achieving these
goals, taking into consideration
historical and contemporary
conditions that either inhibit or
advance the creation of individual
and generational wealth.

495890E8480D457A8AFC1C8DAD971AFC.description:
Identify measures of income distribution, wealth distribution,
causes of income inequality, and poverty. Explain how these
affect, and are affected by, the economy. Evaluate the
effectiveness of, and incentives created by, government income
redistribution programs.

8CEBFFF00C634079B1C4A239D260B3FE.description:
Fundamental Economic
Concepts: Analyze how scarcity
and artificial shortages force
individuals, organizations,
communities, and governments
to make choices and incur
opportunity costs. Analyze how
the decisions of individuals,
organizations, communities, and
governments affect economic
equity and efficiency.

AACE45EC5AE444EBA14823DEA73041A2.description:
Define broad long-run economic goals, and describe the tradeoffs that exist between them; evaluate how different economic
systems prioritize these goals, and evaluate the intended and
unintended consequences.

4E110FFFB8124DBBB66001B082BFB01F.description:
Fundamental Economic
Concepts: Analyze how scarcity
and artificial shortages force
individuals, organizations,
communities, and governments
to make choices and incur
opportunity costs. Analyze how
the decisions of individuals,
organizations, communities, and
governments affect economic
equity and efficiency.

0707530B90BB446E9EABFA3C10154579.description:
Compare and contrast the characteristics of traditional,
command (planned), market-based and mixed economic
systems. Demonstrate how most economies are mixed
economies with varying degrees of government involvement.

E02161693FFF47C698C774019FC04779.description:
Fundamental Economic
Concepts: Analyze how scarcity
and artificial shortages force
individuals, organizations,
communities, and governments
to make choices and incur
opportunity costs. Analyze how
the decisions of individuals,
organizations, communities, and
governments affect economic
equity and efficiency.

C9BED28E815F4F2F9D50617146013DB2.description:
Explain how the availability of and access to productive
resources and technology limits the production of goods and
services.

BA289E45C8644DFEA4897433709C8FF5.description:
Fundamental Economic
Concepts: Analyze how scarcity
and artificial shortages force
individuals, organizations,
communities, and governments
to make choices and incur
opportunity costs. Analyze how
the decisions of individuals,
organizations, communities, and
governments affect economic
equity and efficiency.

3EE3C881469641D586486CE69B1B5954.description:
Describe the opportunity cost of a choice and analyze the
consequences of a specific choice, both intended and
unintended.

2E085DA1A8454A37807D4BE95484C2EE.description:
Fundamental Economic
Concepts: Analyze how scarcity
and artificial shortages force
individuals, organizations,
communities, and governments
to make choices and incur
opportunity costs. Analyze how
the decisions of individuals,
organizations, communities, and
governments affect economic
equity and efficiency.

7DF3594F75594350968DEF22095BE68F.description: Use economic analysis to explore an economic question.

F799943314644C2B9E2D834962162B82.description:
Economic Inquiry: Use
economic models and reasoning
and data analysis to construct an
argument and propose a solution
related to an economic question.
Evaluate the impact of the
proposed solution on various
communities that would be
affected.
